page.title: 04My First Impression!
page.content: When I first came to the village it looked very,very dull.There was no life.No people rushing around,hardly any buses,hardly any bikes,hardly any people about and no towns nearby. I made friends very easily and now I am used to the place. When the Stonehill people were coming home they started to pick on me and call me names but I took no notice. Now I have alot of friends some in Cossington and some in Sileby. There are fields everywhere and farms. It's a good place for train spotting because it's on the main line between Loughborough and London,you get all different types of trains.It's an ideal environment for bird spotting. By George Owen,AGE{11.
